Da Rules

General
0. I am the Mod, your god. What I say is law.
1. Play to your wincon, but do not lose sight of the fact that it is a game.
2. Do not discuss the game outside of the gamethread.
3. Do not post your role PM.
4. No smalltext, no invisible text, etc.
5. Do not use my colour.

Activity and Deadlines
6. If a player does not post for 72 hours, they will receive a prod. If they do not post within 48 hours of this prod, they will be replaced.
7. Day one will last three weeks. All subsequent days will last two weeks. All nights will last 72 hours, or as long as it takes to receive confirmation from all players that they wish to end night early.
8. When a player replaces in, depending on the phase they replace into, day deadline will be extended by half the time it took to find the replacement, or night deadline will be extended 36 hours.

Voting and Death
9. Votes are to be submitted in the form Vote: PLAYERNAME or VOTE: PLAYERNAME. You may write 'no lynch' in the place of PLAYERNAME if you wish not to lynch anyone.
10. If, by deadline, no-one has attracted the majority of the votes, nobody is lynched.
11. Once a player attracts the majority of the votes, the game enters twilight. All players may talk until I lock the thread.
12. You are dead when I declare you dead. Dead people do not talk. No "Bah!" post.

The Golden Rule
13. Apply common sense. By extension: if you think you have found a loophole in these rules, you haven't.

At least one person in the game has been sent this role PM:

Hello, PLAYERNAME, you are a Vanilla Townie!

You win when all threats to the town have been eliminated.

You have no night actions or other special powers. However, you may PM me a null action if you wish to end night early.

Confirm in thread.

In post 861, penguin_alien wrote:It does seem unlikely that we have a two-man scum team with a two-shot vig, as that would allow the vig to single-handedly destroy the scum. I'd expect town as a group would need to be responsible for one scum kill any way it fell out to win.
Actually, this line of reasoning almost had me abandon the set-up in the draft stage. In the end, I decided that if the vig was able to shoot both scum single-handedly, scum were obvious enough that they were probably going to lose anyway (and the odds of it happening through random shooting were low enough that I didn't feel it an issue).

Set-up was pretty much based on the premise that 11:2 is slightly scum-sided, so 11:2 with a weak town PR should make the game pretty much balanced. Having seen the result, I think I still agree re: balance, but it swang far harder than I'm happy with (lucky SAS shot pretty much won the game). Would run on similar philosophy again, but would want to consider swing more carefully than I did.

I think this game really highlighted the weaknesses in my play. I'm very glad we won and I didn't mess up the game enough to fuck it all up, and I can definitely look back at this game and look at what I did wrong; my tunnel visioning nearly lost the game on multiple occasions. I really should have picked up on Ztife's slip when he made his huge list of reasons we need to lynch SK and had like a million with "SCUM WIN". Fearmongering for the sake of fearmongering.

The way I saw it was that there was no way it could be 2 Scum vs 9 Town, but I guess I was just wrong on that account; that's the main thing that screwed up my play towards the end.

This was my first game in quite some time and it was a good game to come back to. I know I swore a lot and got angry and flustered, but part of it is a persona I put on, I guess? I tend to be insanely easy to read emotionally IRL so if I just act myself everyone'll be able to know who I am.

Again, apologies for my bad play, congratulations to don for pretty much single handedly winning the game and if anybody else has anything that I did drastically wrong aside from tunnel vision like a bitch, be sure to bring it up so I'm not as much of a problem next time =P
